column4: Do you know if 8.10 has any better support for Atheros Wireless Cards?
Oops meant scunizi
not sure but my bet is it will be.
see above ^--^
System>Admin>synaptic
click the search button and type in nvidia.. there will be lots of things.. just scroll to the nvidia section and you'll see it.
no just the legacy one
also have you looked at system>admin>hardware drivers? might already be listed there.
did you get the driver enabled?
open a terminal and type glxgears.. do you see anything?
Applications>accessories
good you're almost there.. close the gears window and do what winston_ said.. glxinfo | grep direct
type that in the terminal
were you able to enable the restricted drivers in system>admin>hardware drivers?
got them going?  your next question will probably be how to get the cube working....
yes.. but I work out of the house
any suggestions to maximise ubuntu potential
depends.. install and learn the programs that make life easier for what you do.  explore options or additions like a lamp server in a virtual machine so you don't muck up your primary system
use a seperate /home for your data.. it makes it easier for upgrades or reinstalls
np :)
reinstall..
without actually reinstalling :p
not that I'm aware of..
an almost easy method is to mirror your partitions just after install and all the updates..
